trans-unit.source: Django and MySQL on Azure with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Django and MySQL on Azure with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Python Tools for Visual Studio to create a Django web app that stores data in a MySQL database instance and deploy it to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Python Tools for Visual Studio to create a Django web app that stores data in a MySQL database instance and deploy it to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Django and MySQL on Azure with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Django and MySQL on Azure with Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we'll use [Python Tools for Visual Studio] to create a simple polls web app using one of the PTVS sample templates.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we'll use [Python Tools for Visual Studio] to create a simple polls web app using one of the PTVS sample templates.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is also available as a [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oKCApIrS0Lo).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is also available as a [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oKCApIrS0Lo).

trans-unit.source: We'll learn how to use a MySQL service hosted on Azure, how to configure the web app to use MySQL, and how to publish the web app to [Azure App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).
trans-unit.target: We'll learn how to use a MySQL service hosted on Azure, how to configure the web app to use MySQL, and how to publish the web app to [Azure App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).

trans-unit.source: See the [Python Developer Center] for more articles that cover development of Azure App Service Web Apps with PTVS using Bottle, Flask and Django web frameworks, with MongoDB, Azure Table Storage, MySQL and SQL Database services.
trans-unit.target: See the [Python Developer Center] for more articles that cover development of Azure App Service Web Apps with PTVS using Bottle, Flask and Django web frameworks, with MongoDB, Azure Table Storage, MySQL and SQL Database services.

trans-unit.source: While this article focuses on App Service, the steps are similar when developing [Azure Cloud Services].
trans-unit.target: While this article focuses on App Service, the steps are similar when developing [Azure Cloud Services].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 or 2015
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 or 2015

trans-unit.source: Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio Samples VSIX
trans-unit.target: Python Tools 2.2 for Visual Studio Samples VSIX

trans-unit.source: [Azure SDK Tools for VS 2013] or [Azure SDK Tools for VS 2015]
trans-unit.target: [Azure SDK Tools for VS 2013] or [Azure SDK Tools for VS 2015]

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7 32-bit
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7 32-bit

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Create the Project
trans-unit.target: Create the Project

trans-unit.source: In this section, we'll create a Visual Studio project using a sample template.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we'll create a Visual Studio project using a sample template.

trans-unit.source: We'll create a virtual environment and install required packages.
trans-unit.target: We'll create a virtual environment and install required packages.

trans-unit.source: We'll create a local database using sqlite.
trans-unit.target: We'll create a local database using sqlite.

trans-unit.source: Then we'll run the application locally.
trans-unit.target: Then we'll run the application locally.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, select **File**, **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, select **File**, **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: The project templates from the PTVS Samples VSIX are available under **Python**, **Samples**.
trans-unit.target: The project templates from the PTVS Samples VSIX are available under **Python**, **Samples**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Polls Django Web Project** and click OK to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Select **Polls Django Web Project** and click OK to create the project.

trans-unit.source: New Project Dialog
trans-unit.target: New Project Dialog

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to install external packages.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to install external packages.

trans-unit.source: Select **Install into a virtual environment**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Install into a virtual environment**.

trans-unit.source: External Packages Dialog
trans-unit.target: External Packages Dialog

trans-unit.source: Select **Python 2.7** as the base interpreter.
trans-unit.target: Select **Python 2.7** as the base interpreter.

trans-unit.source: Add Virtual Environment Dialog
trans-unit.target: Add Virtual Environment Dialog

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project node and select **Python**, **Django Sync DB**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project node and select **Python**, **Django Sync DB**.

trans-unit.source: Django Sync DB Command
trans-unit.target: Django Sync DB Command

trans-unit.source: This will open a Django Management Console.
trans-unit.target: This will open a Django Management Console.

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts to create a user.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts to create a user.

trans-unit.source: This will create a sqlite database in the project folder.
trans-unit.target: This will create a sqlite database in the project folder.

trans-unit.source: Django Management Console Window
trans-unit.target: Django Management Console Window

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the application works by pressing <kbd>F5</kbd>.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the application works by pressing <kbd>F5</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: Click **Log in** from the navigation bar at the top.
trans-unit.target: Click **Log in** from the navigation bar at the top.

trans-unit.source: Web Browser
trans-unit.target: Web Browser

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials for the user you created when you synchronized the database.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials for the user you created when you synchronized the database.

trans-unit.source: Web Browser
trans-unit.target: Web Browser

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Sample Polls**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Sample Polls**.

trans-unit.source: Web Browser
trans-unit.target: Web Browser

trans-unit.source: Click on a poll and vote.
trans-unit.target: Click on a poll and vote.

trans-unit.source: Web Browser
trans-unit.target: Web Browser

trans-unit.source: Create a MySQL Database
trans-unit.target: Create a MySQL Database

trans-unit.source: For the database, we'll create a ClearDB MySQL hosted database on Azure.
trans-unit.target: For the database, we'll create a ClearDB MySQL hosted database on Azure.

trans-unit.source: As an alternative, you can create your own Virtual Machine running in Azure, then install and administer MySQL yourself.
trans-unit.target: As an alternative, you can create your own Virtual Machine running in Azure, then install and administer MySQL yourself.

trans-unit.source: You can create a database with a free plan by following these steps.
trans-unit.target: You can create a database with a free plan by following these steps.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the navigation pane, click **NEW**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the navigation pane, click **NEW**.

trans-unit.source: Then, click **Data + Storage** > **Azure Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: Then, click **Data + Storage** > **Azure Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Type "**mysql**" in the search box, then click **MySQL Database**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Type "**mysql**" in the search box, then click **MySQL Database**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Configure the new MySQL database by creating a new resource group and select the appropriate location for it.
trans-unit.target: Configure the new MySQL database by creating a new resource group and select the appropriate location for it.

trans-unit.source: Once the MySQL database is created, click **Properties** in the database blade.
trans-unit.target: Once the MySQL database is created, click **Properties** in the database blade.

trans-unit.source: Use the copy button to put the value of **CONNECTION STRING** on the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Use the copy button to put the value of **CONNECTION STRING** on the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Project
trans-unit.target: Configure the Project

trans-unit.source: In this section, we'll configure our web app to use the MySQL database we just created.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we'll configure our web app to use the MySQL database we just created.

trans-unit.source: We'll also install additional Python packages required to use MySQL databases with Django.
trans-unit.target: We'll also install additional Python packages required to use MySQL databases with Django.

trans-unit.source: Then we'll run the web app locally.
trans-unit.target: Then we'll run the web app locally.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open **settings.py**, from the *ProjectName* folder.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open **settings.py**, from the *ProjectName* folder.

trans-unit.source: Temporarily paste the connection string in the editor.
trans-unit.target: Temporarily paste the connection string in the editor.

trans-unit.source: The connection string is in this format:
trans-unit.target: The connection string is in this format:

trans-unit.source: Change the default database **ENGINE** to use MySQL, and set the values for **NAME**, **USER**, **PASSWORD** and **HOST** from the **CONNECTIONSTRING**.
trans-unit.target: Change the default database **ENGINE** to use MySQL, and set the values for **NAME**, **USER**, **PASSWORD** and **HOST** from the **CONNECTIONSTRING**.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, under **Python Environments**, right-click on the virtual environment and select **Install Python Package**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, under **Python Environments**, right-click on the virtual environment and select **Install Python Package**.

trans-unit.source: Install the package `mysql-python` using **easy_install**.
trans-unit.target: Install the package `mysql-python` using **easy_install**.

trans-unit.source: Install Package Dialog
trans-unit.target: Install Package Dialog

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project node and select **Python**, **Django Sync DB**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project node and select **Python**, **Django Sync DB**.

trans-unit.source: This will create the tables for the MySQL database we created in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: This will create the tables for the MySQL database we created in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts to create a user, which doesn't have to match the user in the sqlite database created in the first section.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts to create a user, which doesn't have to match the user in the sqlite database created in the first section.

trans-unit.source: Django Management Console Window
trans-unit.target: Django Management Console Window

trans-unit.source: Run the application with `F5`.
trans-unit.target: Run the application with `F5`.

trans-unit.source: Polls that are created with **Create Sample Polls** and the data submitted by voting will be serialized in the MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Polls that are created with **Create Sample Polls** and the data submitted by voting will be serialized in the MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: Publish the web app to Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Publish the web app to Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: The Azure .NET SDK provides an easy way to deploy your web app to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure .NET SDK provides an easy way to deploy your web app to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click on the project node and select **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click on the project node and select **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: Publish Web Dialog
trans-unit.target: Publish Web Dialog

trans-unit.source: Click on **Microsoft Azure Web Apps**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Microsoft Azure Web Apps**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **New** to create a new web app.
trans-unit.target: Click on **New** to create a new web app.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the following fields and click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the following fields and click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Web App name
trans-unit.target: Web App name

trans-unit.source: App Service plan
trans-unit.target: App Service plan

trans-unit.source: Resource group
trans-unit.target: Resource group

trans-unit.source: Region
trans-unit.target: Region

trans-unit.source: Leave **Database server** set to **No database**
trans-unit.target: Leave **Database server** set to **No database**

trans-unit.source: Accept all other defaults and click **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: Accept all other defaults and click **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: Your web browser will open automatically to the published web app.
trans-unit.target: Your web browser will open automatically to the published web app.

trans-unit.source: You should see the web app working as expected, using the **MySQL** database hosted on Azure.
trans-unit.target: You should see the web app working as expected, using the **MySQL** database hosted on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: Web Browser
trans-unit.target: Web Browser

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
